I have the same problem. I use helper something like

def _variable_summaries(var, name):
    with tf.name_scope("stats"):
        with tf.name_scope('mean'):
            mean = tf.reduce_mean(var)
            tf.summary.scalar(name, mean)
        with tf.name_scope('sttdev'):
            tf.summary.scalar(name, tf.sqrt(tf.reduce_sum(tf.square(var - mean))))
        with tf.name_scope('max'):
            tf.summary.scalar(name, tf.reduce_max(var))
        with tf.name_scope('min'):
            tf.summary.scalar(name, tf.reduce_min(var))
    tf.summary.histogram(name, var)

which I call with

_variable_summaries(weights, layer_name + '/weights')
_variable_summaries(biases, layer_name + '/biases')

for each layer as it is created.

This used to create a collection of stats for each layer (one panel/scope per layer, containing all the collected stats). But now I get two stats_X layers for each layer. I also get a mess when trying to track anything that iterates and attempts to "accumulate" values in a single scope over time, like the global step or the elapsed time taken by an epoch.

Is there a workaround I'm missing? Is this the intended behavior now?

(I think I actually found _variable_summaries in older Tensorflow docs.)

I have the same problem. I use helper something like

```
def _variable_summaries(var, name):
    with tf.name_scope("stats"):
        with tf.name_scope('mean'):
            mean = tf.reduce_mean(var)
            tf.summary.scalar(name, mean)
        with tf.name_scope('sttdev'):
            tf.summary.scalar(name, tf.sqrt(tf.reduce_sum(tf.square(var - mean))))
        with tf.name_scope('max'):
            tf.summary.scalar(name, tf.reduce_max(var))
        with tf.name_scope('min'):
            tf.summary.scalar(name, tf.reduce_min(var))
    tf.summary.histogram(name, var)
```

which I call with 

```
_variable_summaries(weights, layer_name + '/weights')
_variable_summaries(biases, layer_name + '/biases')
```

for each layer as it is created.

This used to create a collection of stats for each layer (one panel/scope per layer, containing all the collected stats). But now I get two `stats_X` layers for each layer. I also get a mess when trying to track anything that iterates and attempts to "accumulate" values in a single scope over time, [like the global step](https://stackoverflow.com/q/44249086/656912) or the elapsed time taken by an epoch.

Is there a workaround I'm missing? Is this the intended behavior now?

(I think I actually found `_variable_summaries` in older Tensorflow docs.)
